text: why do we care so much about what other
people think about us a lot of us worry
about it on some level almost like it's
a default setting that we can't control
well research says that humans actually
do have an innate need to be liked and
the origins of this feeling lie in our
desire to belong in ancient times people
relied on social groups for food shelter
and security so you needed to be
accepted to meet your basic needs and
survive but today Society has evolved D
and so have technologies that help us
meet many of those same needs on our own
likeability as a result has become less
a mechanism for survival and more a way
that we measure our selfworth that's why
today many of us still equate being good
or worthy of love with the number of
people who like us even when we don't
like them all back but one of our
authors says the best way to fulfill
this desire to belong is not by looking
outward to others but inward to
ourselves so the next time you feel
worried about what someone else thinks
of you or maybe just feel out of place
hopefully this advice from their article
will be helpful
